title: Punishment for murder
text: Whoever commits murder shall be punished with death, or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Cheating and dishonesty
text: Whoever cheats and thereby dishonestly induces the person deceived to deliver any property shall be punished with imprisonment and fine.

title: Examination of witnesses by police
text: Police officer may examine witnesses acquainted with the facts and circumstances of the case.

title: Power to issue order in urgent cases
text: Magistrate may issue order in urgent cases of nuisance or apprehended danger.

title: What agreements are contracts
text: All agreements are contracts if they are made by free consent of parties competent to contract, for a lawful consideration and with a lawful object.

title: Compensation for loss
text: When a contract has been broken, the party suffering by such breach is entitled to receive compensation for any loss caused by the breach.

title: Divorce
text: Any marriage may be dissolved by a decree of divorce on grounds specified in the Act.

title: Conditions for Hindu marriage
text: A marriage may be solemnized between any two Hindus, if the conditions specified in the Act are fulfilled.

title: Company members
text: The liability of the members of a company limited by shares shall be limited to the amount unpaid on the shares.

title: Punishment for fraud
text: Any person guilty of fraud shall be punishable with imprisonment and fine.

title: Sexual Harassment
text: Any person who sexually harass a women is found guilty

title: Title and extent of operation of the Code
text: This section establishes the name of the code as the "Indian Penal Code" and defines its geographical scope of application within India.

title: Punishment of offences committed within India
text: This means if you commit a crime defined by the IPC within India's territory you will be punished according to the IPC

title: Punishment of offences committed beyond but which by law may be tried within India
text: This covers situations where Indian law allows for the trial of offenses committed outside India such as certain crimes committed by Indian citizens abroad

title: Extention of Code to extra-territorial offences
text: This section enables the Indian Government to prosecute crimes that have an impact on India even if they are commited outside of the geographical borders.

title: Certain laws not to be affected by this Act
text: This section clarifies that the IPC does not override specific military laws or other special or local laws that may exist

title: Definitions in the Code to be understood subject to exceptions
text: This means that all definitions and punishments in the IPC are subject to the general exceptions such as those related to insanity or self-defense.

title: Sense of expression once explained
text: Once a term is defined in the IPC that definition applies consistently throughout the code.

title: Gender
text: This section clarifies that references to the masculine gender in the IPC also include the feminine gender.

title: Number
text: This means that singular and plural forms are interchangeable unless the context suggests otherwise.

title: Man Woman
text: The word 'man' denotes a male human being of any age; the word 'woman' denotes a female human being of any age." This provides basic definitions for these terms.

title: Person
text: The word 'person' includes any Company or Association or body of persons whether incorporated or not.

title: Public
text: The word 'public' includes any class of the public or any community.

title: Queen
text: This section is now obsolete. It refered to the British Queen and is no longer relevant in independent India.

title: Servant of Government
text: This section defines "servant of Government" to include any officer or servant continued appointed or employed in India by or under the authority of Government.

title: Definition of �India�
text: This section defines "India" for the purposes of the IPC. It refers to the territory of India excluding the state of Jammu and Kashmir. However after the Jammu and Kashmir Reorganisation Act 2019 the definition of India in the IPC now includes the entire territory of India.

title: Government of India
text: This section defines "Government of India" as referring to the Central Government.

title: Government
text: This section defines "Government" as the Central Government or the Government of a State. This is important for understanding which government entities are being referenced in various IPC provisions

title: India
text: As mentioned before this section defines "India" for the purposes of the IPC. It refers to the territory of India. After the Jammu and Kashmir Reorganisation Act 2019 the definition of India in the IPC now includes the entire territory of India.

title: Judge
text: Judge" is defined as not only every person who is officially designated as a Judge but also every person who is empowered by law to give in any legal proceeding civil or criminal a definitive judgment

title: Court of Justice
text: Court of Justice" is defined as a Judge empowered by law to act judicially alone or a body of Judges empowered by law to act judicially as a body when such Judge or body of Judges is acting judicially

title: Public servant
text: It includes a wide range of individuals holding public office such as officers in the military judges officers of courts of justice officers of the government and those involved in elections

title: Movable property
text: Movable property" is defined as including corporeal property of every description except land and things permanently attached to the earth or fastened to anything which is attached to the earth

title: Wrongful gain
text: This highlights the illegality of acquiring property that one does not have a legal right to

title: Dishonestly
text: This emphasizes the intent behind an action focusing on the intention to cause illegal gain or loss

title: Fraudulently
text: This focuses on the intent to deceive or trick someone and to cause them to lose property or some other legal right.

title: Reason to believe
text: This section sets a standard for when a person can be held to have knowledge or awareness of something

title: Property in possession of wife clerk or servant
text: When property is in the possession of a person's wife clerk or servant on that person's account it is considered to be in that person's possession

title: Counterfeit
text: This defines the act of creating a false copy with the intent to deceive

title: Document
text: The word 'document' denotes any matter expressed or described upon any substance by means of letters figures or marks or by more than one of those means intended to be used or which may be used as evidence of that matter

title: Electronic record
text: This section defines �electronic record� as assigned to it in clause (t) of sub-section (1) of section 2 of the Information Technology Act 2000. This section links the IPC to definitions within the Information Technology Act

title: Valuable security
text: This defines documents that hold legal value

title: A will
text: This provides a simple definition related to documents that dictate the distribution of property after death

title: Words referring to acts include illegal omissions
text: This means that if something is illegal to not do then that in action can be prosecuted as an act.

title: Act omission
text: The word 'act' denotes as well a series of acts as a single act: the word 'omission' denotes as well a series of omissions as a single omission.

title: Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention
text: When a criminal act is done by several persons in furtherance of the common intention of all each of such persons is liable for that act in the same manner as if it were done by him alone

title: When such an act is criminal by reason of its being done with a criminal knowledge or intention
text: When an act which is criminal only by reason of its being done with a criminal knowledge or intention is done by several persons each of such persons who joins in the act with such knowledge or intention is liable for the act in the same manner as if the act were done by him alone with that knowledge or intention

title: Effect caused partly by act and partly by omission
text: This means criminals can't devide up criminal actions in order to try and become less culpable

title: Co-operation by doing one of several acts constituting an offence
text: When an offence is committed by means of any one of a series of acts which together constitute that offence every person who intentionally co-operates in the commission of that offence by doing any one of those acts either singly or jointly with any other person commits that offence

title: Persons concerned in criminal act may be guilty of different offences
text: This means that even involved in the same act the people involved can be held accountable for different offences.

title: Voluntarily
text: A person is said to cause an effect voluntarily when they cause it by means which they intended or knew were likely to cause it.

title: Offence
text: An offence is any act or omission made punishable by The Indian Penal Code (IPC) or Any special or local law where the law defines it as an offence.

title: Special law
text: A special law is a law enacted for a specific purpose or class of offences that overrides the general law in those cases.

title: Local law
text: A local law is a law applicable only to a specific part of India (such as a state or district) unlike IPC which applies to the whole country.

title: Illegal �legally bound to do�
text: The word "illegal" applies to everything prohibited by law including Acts that are offences under IPC Acts that are prohibited by law but not necessarily offences Acts that form a reason to sue in a civil court.

title: Injury
text: Injury means any harm to a person's body mind reputation or property.

title: Life
text: The word "life" refers to the life of a human being unless otherwise specified.

title: Death
text: The term "death" refers only to the death of a human being. It does not include the death of an animal.

title: Animal
text: The term "animal" means any living creature other than a human being.

title: Vessel
text: A vessel refers to anything made for water transportation regardless of how it moves (engine-powered sail or rowboat).

title: Year and month
text: In IPC A year means 12 months and A month means 30 days unless stated otherwise.

title: Section
text: Denotes a section of the Indian Penal Code

title: Oath
text: Includes a solemn affirmation substituted by law for an oath.

title: Good faith
text: Nothing is said to be done or believed in "good faith" which is done or believed without due care and attention.

title: Harbour
text: Includes the supply of shelter food drink money clothes arms ammunition or means of conveyance or the assisting a person in any way to evade apprehension.

title: Punishments
text: Describes the various punishments to which offenders are liable under the IPC.

title: Construction of reference to �transportation�
text: Explains how references to the former punishment of transportation should be construed.

title: Commutation of sentence of death
text: Empowers the appropriate government to commute a sentence of death.

title: Commutation of sentence of imprisonment for life
text: Empowers the appropriate government to commute a sentence of imprisonment for life.

title: Definition of �appropriate Government�
text: Defines the "appropriate Government" for the purposes of commuting sentences.

title: Sentence of Europeans and Americans to penal servitude
text: This section is now obsolete.

title: Fractions of terms of punishment
text: Deals with the calculation of fractions of terms of punishment

title: Repealed
text: These sections are repealed.

title: Repealed
text: These sections are repealed.

title: Sentence may be (in certain cases of imprisonment) wholly or partly rigorous or simple
text: Allows for sentences of imprisonment to be either wholly or partly rigorous (with hard labor) or simple.

title: Repealed
text: These sections are repealed.

title: Repealed
text: These sections are repealed.

title: Amount of fine
text: States that where no sum is expressed to which a fine may extend the amount of fine to which the offender is liable is unlimited but shall not be excessive

title: Sentence of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
text: Provides for imprisonment in default of payment of a fine.

title: Limit to imprisonment for non-payment of fine when imprisonment and fine awardable
text: Sets the limit for imprisonment in default of payment of a fine when both imprisonment and a fine are imposed.

title: Description of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
text: Specifies the nature of the imprisonment imposed for non-payment of a fine.

title: Imprisonment for non-payment of fine when offence punishable with fine only
text: Deals with imprisonment for non-payment of a fine when the offence is punishable with a fine only.

title: Imprisonment to terminate on payment of fine
text: States that imprisonment terminates upon payment of the fine.

title: Termination of imprisonment on payment of proportional part of fine
text: Provides for the termination of imprisonment upon payment of a proportional part of the fine.

title: Fine leviable within six years or death
text: Specifies the time limit for levying a fine.

title: Limit of punishment of offence made up of several offences
text: Sets the limit of punishment when an offence is made up of several offences.

title: Punishment of person guilty of one of several offences the judgment stating that it is doubtful of which
text: Deals with punishment when a person is guilty of one of several offences but it is doubtful which

title: Solitary confinement
text: Provides for the imposition of solitary confinement.

title: Limit of solitary confinement
text: Sets the limit for solitary confinement.

title: Enhanced punishment for certain offences under Chapters XII or XVII after previous conviction
text: Provides for enhanced punishment for repeat offenders of certain property and coin-related offences.

title: Act done by a person bound or by mistake of fact believing himself bound by law
text: Provides an exception for acts done under a mistake of fact.

title: Act of Judge when acting judicially
text: Provides an exception for acts of a judge when acting judicially.

title: Act done pursuant to the judgment or order of Court
text: Provides an exception for acts done pursuant to a court order.

title: Act justified by law or by mistake of fact believing himself justified by law
text: Provides exception for acts justified by law or under mistake of fact.

title: Accident in doing a lawful act
text: Provides an exception for accidents occurring while doing a lawful act.

title: Act likely to cause harm but done without criminal intent and to prevent other harm
text: �Provides an exception for acts done to prevent greater harm.

title: Act of a child under seven years of age
text: Provides an exception for acts of children under seven years of age.

title: Act of a child above seven and under twelve of immature understanding
text: Provides an exception for acts of children between seven and twelve of immature understanding.

title: Act of person of unsound mind
text: Provides an exception for acts of persons of unsound mind.

title: Act of a person incapable of judgment by reason of intoxication caused against his will
text: Provides an exception for acts done under involuntary intoxication.

title: Offence requiring a particular intent or knowledge committed by one who is intoxicated
text: Deals with offences committed under voluntary intoxication.

title: Act not intended and not known to be likely to cause death or grievous hurt done by consent
text: Provides an exception for acts done with consent.

title: Act not intended to cause death done by consent in good faith for person�s benefit
text: Provides an exception for acts done with consent for a person's benefit.

title: Act done in good faith for benefit of child or insane person by or by consent of guardian
text: Provides an exception for acts done in good faith for the benefit of a child or insane person.

title: Consent known to be given under fear or misconception
text: Defines consent when given under fear or misconception.

title: Consent known to be given under fear or misconception
text: Deals with acts that are offences regardless of consent.

title: Act done in good faith for benefit of a person without consent
text: Provides an exception for acts done in good faith for a person's benefit without consent.

title: Communication made in good faith
text: Provides an exception for communications made in good faith.

title: Act to which a person is compelled by threats
text: Provides an exception for acts done under compulsion.

title: Act causing slight harm
text: Provides an exception for acts causing slight harm.

title: Things done in private defence
text: Introduces the right of private defence.

title: Right of private defence of the body and of property
text: Defines the right of private defence.

title: Right of private defence against the act of a person of unsound mind etc.
text: Deals with the right of private defence against acts of persons of unsound mind.

title: Acts against which there is no right of private defence
text: Defines the limitations of the right of private defence.

title: When the right of private defence of the body extends to causing death
text: Specifies when the right of private defence of the body extends to causing death.

title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
text: Specifies when the right of private defence extends to causing harm other than death.

title: Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of the body
text: Defines the commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of the body.

title: When the right of private defence of property extends to causing death
text: Specifies when the right of private defence of property extends to causing death.

title: When such right extends to causing any harm other than death
text: Specifies when the right of private defence of property extends to causing harm other than death.

title: Commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of property
text: Defines the commencement and continuance of the right of private defence of property.

title: Right of private defence against deadly assault when there is risk of harm to innocent person
text: Addresses self-defense when innocent bystanders are at risk.

title: Abetment of a thing
text: Defines what constitutes abetting a crime.

title: Abettor
text: Defines who is considered an abettor.

title: Abetment of acts outside India
text: Addresses abetment of offenses committed in other countries.

title: Punishment of abetment if the act abetted is committed in consequence and where no express provision is made for its punishment
text: Specifies the punishment for abetment when the act is committed.

title: Punishment of abetment if person abetted does act with different intention from that of abettor
text: Addresses punishment when the abettor and principal have different intentions.

title: Liability of abettor when one act abetted and different act done
text: Explains liability when a different act than the abetted one is committed.

title: Abettor when liable to cumulative punishment for act abetted and for act done
text: Addresses cumulative punishment for the abetted and committed acts.

title: Liability of abettor for an act caused by the abettor which he intended or knew himself likely to cause
text: Explains liability when the effect of the act is different from the abettor's intent.

title: Abettor present when offence is committed
text: Addresses the liability of an abettor who is present at the commission of the offense.

title: Abetment of offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life�if offence not committed
text: Specifies punishment for abetment of serious offenses when the offense is not committed.

title: Abetment of offence punishable with imprisonment�if offence not committed
text: Specifies punishment for abetment of other offenses when the offense is not committed.

title: Abetting commission of offence by the public or by more than ten persons
text: Addresses abetment of offenses committed by a large group.

title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life
text: Specifies punishment for concealing the intention to commit serious offenses.

title: Public servant concealing design to commit offence which it is his duty to prevent
text: Addresses punishment for public servants who conceal plans to commit offenses they should prevent.

title: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
text: Specifies punishment for concealing plans to commit other offenses.

title: Definition of criminal conspiracy
text: Defines what constitutes a criminal conspiracy.

title: Punishment of criminal conspiracy
text: Specifies the punishment for criminal conspiracy.

title: Waging or attempting to wage war or abetting waging of war against the Government of India
text: Addresses the offense of waging war against the government.

title: AConspiracy to commit offences punishable by section
text: Addresses conspiracy to commit offenses related to waging war.

title: Collecting arms etc. with intent to wage war against the Government of India
text: Addresses the offense of collecting arms to wage war.

title: Concealing with intent to facilitate design to wage war
text: Addresses concealing information to aid waging war.

title: Assaulting President Governor etc. with intent to compel or restrain the exercise of any lawful power
text: Addresses assault on high officials to influence their duties.
